availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jonathan Newcum (Rockcastle County, Kentucky, attorney and politician)

body.p: Rockcastle County, Kentucky, attorney and politician. Rockcastle County, Kentucky, native. Married to Lucy Chesnut Newcum. Father of Charlotte S. Newcum, Artemesia Newcum, and James G. Newcum. Deputy sheriff of Rockcastle County, Kentucky, in 1847. Delegate to the Kentucky Constitutional Convention of 1849 from Laurel and Rockcastle counties. Attorney in Rockcastle County in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Rockcastle County from 1857 to 1859. Attorney in Rockcastle County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Rockcastle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. I (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1874), 367.
Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, Collins' Historical Sketches of Kentucky, vol. II (Covington, KY: Collins & Co., 1874), 691.
Taliaferro P. Shaffner, The Kentucky State Register for the Year 1847 (Louisville, KY: Morton & Griswold, 1847), 149.
Journal of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky (Frankfort, KY: A. G. Hodges, Public Printer, 1857), 429.
